metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1073 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A memory corruption flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s human interface device (HID) subsystem in how a user inserts a malicious USB device. This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system. It was discovered that the Human Interface Device (HID) support driver in the Linux kernel contained a type confusion vulnerability in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
